name: Layout.StartApp

aliases.name: Config
aliases.comment: Like `StartApp.Config`, except the view produces `Layout` instead of `Html`.
aliases.type: { init : ( model, Effects.Effects action ) , update : action -> model -> ( model, Effects.Effects action ) , view : Signal.Address action -> model -> Layout.Layout , inputs : List (Signal.Signal action) }

values.name: start
values.comment: Like `StartApp.start`, except taking a Config with a view the produces `Layout` instead of `Html`.

name: Layout.Circular

types.name: CircularLayout
types.comment: A graphical element that will be rendered into a particular circular bounds at a later time.

values.name: canvas
values.comment: Create a `Layout` that renders a CiruclarLayout within an ellipse filling its bounds.

values.name: fill
values.comment:
An element that fills its bounds with a color.

    Layout.fill Color.red

values.name: rotate
values.comment: Shift the angle of a child

values.name: slice
values.comment: Divide the region into multiple children by angle.

name: Layout

aliases.name: Layout
aliases.comment: A graphical element that will be rendered into a particular bounds at a later time.

values.name: bottom
values.comment:
Position two elements vertically, with the first element taking a given height

    Layout.bottom 50
        (Layout.placeholder "footer")
        (Layout.placeholder "content")

values.name: center
values.comment: Makes a centered area of a size that is calculated with the given function.

values.name: croppedImage
values.comment:
An image cropped to a specific region of the source image.
The cropped region will be scaled to fill the bounds that this element renders into.

    Layout.croppedImage 50 70 "tiles50x70.png" 10 10 20 30
values.type: Float -> Float -> Layout.Image -> Float -> Float -> Float -> Float -> Layout.Layout

values.name: fill
values.comment:
An element that fills its bounds with a color.

    Layout.fill Color.red

values.name: flow
values.comment:
An element that renders a list of children into bounds of a given size and
lays them out in a left-to-right flow that wraps at this element's bounds

    Layout.flow (32,32) (List.map fill [Color.red, Color.blue])

values.name: image
values.comment:
An element that renders an image.

    Layout.image "mario.png"

values.name: inset
values.comment:
A container element that inserts padding around its child

    withBorder child = Layout.stack
        [ Layout.fill Color.grey
        , Layout.inset 2 child
        ]

values.name: left
values.comment:
Position two elements horizontally, with the first element taking a given height

    Layout.left 50
        (Layout.placeholder "left side")
        (Layout.placeholder "content")

values.name: list
values.comment:
An element that renders a list of children in a vertical list with a given height.

The list will scroll vertically if there are enough children to exceed the vertical bounds of the list.

    Layout.list 44 (List.map placeholder ["Item 1", "Item 2", "Item 3"])

values.name: onClick
values.comment: Adds a click listener to an element

values.name: placeholder
values.comment:
An element intended to be a placeholder for something that will be implemented at
a later time.  The placeholder will show the given text and will use the text to generate a
unique color to fill the placeholder's bounds.

This element is intended to aid in quick prototyping where you want to reserve an area on the screen
to implement at a later time.

    view = Layout.top 50
        (Layout.placeholder "header")
        (Layout.placeholder "content")

values.name: right
values.comment:
Position two elements horizontally, with the first element taking a given height

    Layout.right 50
        (Layout.placeholder "right side")
        (Layout.placeholder "content")

values.name: square
values.comment:
Makes a a centered area with width equal to height

    Layout.square (Layout.placeholder "square content")

values.name: stack
values.comment:
An element that renders a list of children on top of one another in the same bounds.

    Layout.stack
        [ Layout.image "background.png"
        , Layout.text "Welcome"
        ]

values.name: svg
values.comment: An element displaying an SVG node

values.name: text
values.comment:
An element that renders text with a given style.

    Layout.text {size=32,color=Color.darkCharcoal} "Welcome"
values.type: { size : Int, color : Color.Color } -> String -> Layout.Layout

values.name: toFullWindow
values.comment:
Simplifies rendering an element to fill the window.

    view = Layout.placeholder "view"
    main = Layout.toFullWindow (Signal.constant view)

values.name: toHtml
values.comment:
Render a Layout to Html.

    view = Layout.placeholder "view"
    main = Layout.toHtml (800, 600) view

values.name: top
values.comment:
Position two elements vertically, with the first element taking a given height

    Layout.top 50
        (Layout.placeholder "header")
        (Layout.placeholder "content")
